alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 27 at 10:21AM CST until March 01 at 11:09AM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Illinois... East Branch Pecatonica River Near Blanchardville affecting Lafayette County. Fox River Lower Near New Munster affecting Lake and Kenosha Counties. .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...East Branch Pecatonica River near Blanchardville. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Floodwaters cover a portion of Highway H and floodwaters are into McKellar Park in Blanchardville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 12 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Tue Wed Thu Fri Blanchardville 11.0 9.0 5.95 9 am 2/27 11.8 9.0 7.5 7.2 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Blanchardville 5.95 9 am 2/27 1.09 11.80 12 pm 2/28 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM CST.
